intro: Asplundia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leafed asplundia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, heart-shaped leaves that are typically glossy in appearance. Its inflorescence consists of a spadix surrounded by a spathe, typical of the Araceae family. Asplundia microphylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
